reviews.review_title: This movie is better than it's score suggest.
reviews.content: I normally only review movies while they are fresh in my mind, but I felt almost obligated to say how much I liked this movie to try and counter the rating that it's got. I think a lot of the hate is coming from the cast. People are mad that Willis isn't in it more, that Phillippe (who is one of the top actors period) is playing a bad guy, and that 50 Cent is in it at all. But truth be told, I liked the cast for the movie. The acting and script weren't Oscar worthy, but watching it late at night on Netflix with no expectations it actually impressed me. This movie is predictable, but so are 99% of movies to me, so that really didn't bother me as much as it seems to every one else. Other than that. If you're a fan of gritty, fun movies, you'll like. If you're wanting to see something complex and moving emotionally, you wont.
I guess director was being creative with lighting. Would have been nice to see faces of actors but what do I know

reviews.review_title: They Setup us up to watch this horrible film
reviews.content: Memo to Bruce Willis, please read the script before signing up to star in any future movies. I can't help but wonder why the former star of the Die Hard series, Pulp Fiction and the Sixth Sense, would agree to be in such a poorly written, poorly acted and most importantly poorly directed movie. I'm not sure how much director Michael Gunther paid Willis, but he should not have accepted, it was not worth the loss of his reputation.This pseudo action flick is difficult to describe in terms of a plot line. It starts out with three friends robbing a guy carrying jewels in the middle of Detroit city. Things go wrong when Vincent Long (Ryan Phillippe) turns on his two friends after the heist. Long shoots one of his friends dead and grazes the other. This is rather unfortunate because if he had killed him the movie would have ended there, putting the innocent viewers out of their misery. Instead Sonny (50 cent) manages to crawl away and survive the shooting.The remainder of the movie is filled with confusing, poorly explained, overlapping plot lines. You have Sonny who is trying to deal with his Christianity which is never explained. Then there is Biggs (Bruce Willis) who is dealing with the Russian mafia who has 2 million dollars of his money. There is a French assassin who is trying to find his diamonds. The prison administrators are trying to get money from Vincent to keep his father in a secure jail section. Of course, the main plot, we have Sonny trying to kill Vincent throughout the whole movie.The problem with the plot lines is that there is lots of holes and they do not connect. For instance, I'm not sure what Detroit police have on their hands as to just dismiss this whole case. There are hundreds of witnesses to the shooting and robbery yet no one thinks it might be logical to call 911. Then the driver of the victim just happens to be the sister of Vincent yet his two best friends don't ever recognize her during the robbery. How about the French assassin we never find out who he works for, or what he has to do with the plot line. He just shows up at random trying to kill people. Also, there was the Russian problem which had nothing to do with the movie. All that does is get Biggs to hire Sonny, who he has never met, to take on this important task. It's all just a jumble of plots that don't make sense.Those weren't the only problems, the actors weren't good, 50 cent lacked emotion. 50 cent please stick to rapping, the next time he acts in a movie 50 cents should be the price of admission. The writing wasn't very good either. If you are still watching this movie after 30 minutes skip to the end and watch the horrible exchange between Sonny and Vincent. That's not how I would talk to a guy I just tried to kill. The directing was also terrible. Right near the end there is a chase between Vincent and Sonny where half way through Sonny all of a sudden has a gun. During the chase the distance between the two will vary immensely without any explanation. How is this film an action film, we have 3 action scenes in this movie and they are all terribly setup. For example, we have a gun fight scene, where miraculously everyone dies except Sonny and Vincent. Sadly the only real actor, Bruce Willis, gets killed at the start of this fight. So my final conclusion is that this movie is a waste of time, money and space. The overall acting was terrible, actors would change/lose accents throughout the film. The movie was all over the place jumping from it's various plots, which made it very difficult to watch. I give this film 1 star and suggest that no one ever wastes their time watching it. Thankfully those younger kids, because its an 18A movie, do not have to go through the pain of watching this film.

I've had enough of 50 trying to make it in thr movie business. Nothing for the past ten years, this movie is crap just like all the ones before it and the ones after. Spare yourselves from watching this junk.

reviews.review_title: Not worth the film that was used
reviews.content: What made this movie so bad was that the script had many holes in it, I was watching this movie with my mom and i bite my mouth to keep me awake during the movie. 50 cent cannot act, since he is a rapper and show himself as a hardcore type of guy it was so hard to believe that he was not able to deliver in this role, he was miscast. The writing was very awful it did not keep up consistently. Action movies are had to do because many people will see 50 cent and Bruce Willis and see a done deal. I questioned why Bruce Willis would take a role, with come many cliché lines. 90 minutes of my life was wasted by watching this movie.

I saw this DVD on the shelf and thought, "ooo, Bruce Willis etc, sounds good" I could not have been more wrong.I only watched about half an hour of this movie, and decided to turn it off when a crazy "butcher" began chopping up a mob guy, and placed his whole body parts, bone and all in a blender which pumped out some tasty looking mince.. i mean it looked supermarket packaged. This guy had previously shot himself in the head.. not the front of the head, but the back.... Accidentally?! and somehow had no exit wound out the front.. and by the way, this happened while purchasing "a bag" to "celebrate" which we came to the conclusion would be some hardcore drugs, turned out to be...... weed.There was zero flow to this movie, things just kinda happened and you are expected to keep up. Bruce Willis apparently stars in this movie for 5 minutes, which leads me to believe he found out how horrible the movie is and decided he had better things to do, like watch paint dry.50 cent......Unfortunately, thats about all this movie is worth..

The plot concept wasn't bad and Bruce Willis is always himself. But there were so many f-bombs that there was almost no real dialogue. It would've worked just as well with no dialogue and 1920s organ music playing throughout.
Setup was whoever got suckered into watching it. Can you please pay me to make a movie, it would be way better than this crap.

There is something very off about this movie. The script was poor and I got like a lot was borrowed from Snatch, 2000 (Jason Statham, Brad Pitt) but with very poor delivery. The butcher gave a speech similar to that Brick Top gave about feeding flesh to the pigs. Lets just say it came up short.The movie does not engage the viewer. It was not exciting. It was not funny. It was not sad. Its bland. If this movie were a gourmet dish, it would be a boiled egg. A salt-less boiled egg.This movie will let you down before the first hour passes.Some issues are not explained, like indeed there are no police in it. No car chases.

reviews.review_title: Let's make a really dumb movie... That is what the maker must have been thinking!

reviews.review_title: Ugh, Excuse Me. You Left, Character Development out of my Order.
reviews.content: I Just saw this movie last night. And, my god, where do I begin... No Character Development what so ever in this film. I got introduced to 30 different characters (which are all labeled in the film via the style of SNATCH) just to get a remote idea of who they are because shortly there after they disappear. die and quickly forgotten. The Direction is AWFUL. I mean, anyone whose seen this film would tell ya, during some comedic scenes offered by Bruce Willis, there was always a serious score underlining the film. Which caused awkward performances. Ryan P. is a BORE. 50, honestly im not gonna start there either. There's nothing rewarding about this movie. There's a random quick Motion zooming in at almost every scene to cast the "badass action" mood that was missing from its lackluster direction. I say, SKIP IT.

reviews.review_title: I do not know how it ends...
reviews.content: Being an avid consumer of movies I can say I watch almost anything that comes up, I do not mind that much quality as long I can fill a couple of hours with a story. But this movie is something else, I haven't seen something that bad in a while, in fact I can say that for the first time a fell asleep towards the end, there was nothing to keep me interested. You see Bruce Willis in the headline and you are thinking, all right, will be another of them mediocre action movies, nothing wrong with them. But in this one Willis manages to add another dimension to non acting, to be honest I believe it was not Willis there, but instead his cybernetic double from Surrogates. All the others are not worth mentioning.

20 minutes into the movie I still had no idea what it was going to be about, however I did know what the F-word sounded like since it was used once every five seconds. Bottom line: There are thousands of movies out there, it's quite easy to pick one better than this waste-of-time movie.

From beginning to end this movie was a complete joke. During chase scenes the camera angles looked like they were done by an iPhone and not even a newer iPhone. The acting was barely even mediocre. Seemed so scripted and forced throughout the entire movie. The plot itself was confusing and made no sense. Did a HORRIBLE job explaining the storyline and not even for a split second did any scene capture the audiences attention.I genuinely lost respect for Bruce Willis as an actor for even accepting this role because there's no way in hell he didn't know how much of a joke this movie would be. Would be shocked if the director ever directed again. Would be shocked if any actor in the film aside from Bruce and 50 (just for his name) we're ever cast in anything outside of a clownish third world country infomercial.

Please if you are going to film make sure you cover the big holesWhy you need to shoot 1000 bullets if no body is shooting back? - How can you shoot more than 1000 bullets in a crowed area and say "the plan was not to kill anybody"? - How his friends knows about his mean father in jail and nothing about his beautiful sister? - Where is the freaking police department in the movie? oh i know the only 2 ones are in jail taking care of the mean father... - if you got your friends off guard with no guns, why would you do 2 crappy shots and run, like somebody is chasing you? -how many big gangsters can a city have? lets see, we have bob, we have "the killer guy" (whos working for someone), the fat guy, the Russians and the ones taking care of the mean father in jail (any relationship?). - why would you need a stupid nobody to do a 2 million dollar job?, specially if you know he just stole from your friends? - why the family of the dead guy will bury him with 2 million dollars? - why would you send 2 stupid Russians to do a 2 million dollar job and nobody is covering their backs? - How can you steel 5 million, then 2 million, then more money from the poker players and be hanging around in the same city with the same stupid car? -Are the Russians growing in trees? "get another Russian"? - If you kidnap a Russian and kill him is the other Russian waiting for you in the same place? - why, tell me why the master bad guy in the movie (Bruce), who just killed 2 Russians (because they were liars), will believe that a nobody (50 cent) is telling the truth about 2 millions with out asking any details about where is the body of his muscle man. and specially with that bad acting face he does. - how can the hit-man find the protagonist, he never got time to go even home...-why the no one is investigating the death of the beloved friend? -50 cent does not rest in the entire movie, not even shower,but he got time to go to church twice, if he does please tell us where... - why would you spread some, I guess flammable, material and try to kill him with a gun? - after 7 days of chasing a guy because he tried to kill you, he runs away, but then you magically appear behind him to hit him with your gun while his off guard... - how can you shoot yourself from the back and spread the blood to the front wall? - how can you be a mafia guy and shoot yourself with a gun? - Why you need the scene with the kid in the supermarket?? we know hes good, he goes to church... - why the sister told the girl in bed to get out, to do what (the scene was cut, no sense at all)? - why the father is talking about big men in life? I guess he does not realize hes in Jail... - where is the freaking police department in this city? - Why everyone gets hit in the back of the head by surprise the entire movie?- If you are a "good boy", that goes to church, and you want to change, why don't you get out of the country, or at least the city with 2 million dollars and start another life? - what happened with all those bad guys after the shooting? are they all dead? nobody shot the 2 main characters? WTF? - why 50 cent got a gun and the other guy does not after the shooting? - Why Bruce Willis accepted this role???last one, where is the freaking police in this movie?!?!?!this is just after watching it once, I guess they are many more questions in this horrible movie.

I never leave reviews but had to for this absolute travesty of a film.It makes no sense at all, it's been written by a team of infinite monkeys.The ending is possibly the worst ending of all time.DO NOT BOTHER, you will never get the time back.

I'm sorry to say but Curtis Jacskon cannot act even if his life depended on it. Added to the fact that both Willis and Philippe had a clear disdain towards the script( Ren and Stimpy had more depth in theirs and they only puked in certain episodes) which showed during their acting performance that would even make Soap opera stars turn around in their graves made this one of the worst movies I've seen in quite a while. If I could sue for mis representing a good movie, I'll still be broke because this movie is terrible. I'll be surprised if Bruce Willis got paid. Supposedly they used a Red camera but not using it's full potential, - or like a Chase scene that keep changing distance in a matter of a cut scene wow! Terrible. Actors? have they lost touch of their ability I'm talking about the pros- 50 cent is in a different element, have a feeling he got the role cause he's famous in a different way (tomato- tahmato.)

The first scene of the movie you knew it was going to be bad. You can easily get lost in the dialog. Characters walking in and out of the scenes is very predictable. You can almost guess what is going to happen at every turn and what they are going to say. Bruce Willis acted normal in this one, good. Curtis Jackson played another role of the gangster who has the good heart, and Ryan Phillippe played the backstabber. Jackson did a good job but when he tries to show emotion it's just poor acting. Phillippe should pick some roles that fit him better, not ones where he has to be the bad guy, just not believable. Overall this movie gets a 5 only because the script was decent. The acting was too quick and the conversations weren't too in-depth. Every scene with Willis in it slowed down to film speed, where you could actually pay attention. The emotional parts in the movie lasted 5 seconds at a time and the action parts lasted even shorter. Mike Gunther, if your reading, you have way more talent than this, please try again for us all.

This is quite possibly one of the best examples you could find of film making at its worst. I managed 35 minutes and the insult to my intelligence could not take anymore. How any of the seasoned actors (and there are a few) who appear in this did not question the shoddy dialogue is a mystery. At first I thought the sound recording was poor - then I realised that its just Curtis 'fiddy cent' s voice is completely monotone - when his mate gets shot, when he gets shot, when he's about to shoot somebody.... it's like he's reading aloud a menu at the drive thru. And whats with the Guy Ritchie stuff - the spinning freeze frame and the cartoon script - not to mention the scenarios pretty much exactly stolen from lock stock and snatch - very lazy. One scene I have to mention is a point where they hijack some Russian gangsters who are digging buried loot from a grave. 50 and another guy literally roll up in a truck, come to a halt, look out of the window and go - 'okay-there they are', then they run over and knock them out stealing the booty. Now I don't know about you, but if I was a professional mobster from Russia who had gone halfway around the world and carved a corrupt empire into a foreign country, I would not let two muppets driving a van into the middle of a cemetery at night with the radio blasting and headlights on 'sneak' up to 15 yards away, park, and then 'surprise' me. I imagine much of the 20million budget of this movie was spent hiring Bruce Willis for one afternoon so they could get his face on the poster.

reviews.review_title: I didn't expect it that bad...
reviews.content: The movie is not worthwhile talking about. Bad acting, bad story. For me the worst movie I have ever seen with Bruce Willis in it...The story doesn't fit together, in the end you still keep wondering about a 100 things. The acting is so bad, that you want to sign up for the job yourself.There are no special effects, except for the gunshots. Boring movie and I really don't know how I managed to see it through. Better skip this movie and search for another one.Was this the last movie of Bruce Willis? This is not Bruce Willis worthy.

reviews.review_title: don't believe the bad reviews , it's a cool off Hollywood action flick .
reviews.content: sure , this movie have some obvious disadvantages- some b or c list actors , plot holes , clichés and so on . but it also has it merits - nice cinematography , high production values, cool soundtrack , the use of unprofessional actors who gives it an almost neorealism flare , the locations , but most of all i enjoyed the non Hollywood feel , an almost anarchistic feel i might say , of going off the platform of your regular blockbaster .50 cent is no denzel washington but still he possesses some genuine quality that is hard to define .it really give you some kind of weird rush that no mainstream Hollywood film would give you .
Almost cheesily bad looking shootouts and just poor writing. Some of the dumb things that happened to advance the plot where over the top. Spend your time better

Great movie? How now? Poor acting, poor plot with no suspense whatsoever. I think the director was asleep for most part. I have never reviewed a movie but i had to do this - to save someone else from watching this.Where do i even start - There was no single cop on the ground through the entire the movie (Did the Mafia boss pay them to lie low?). How were we supposed to be kept on the edge if there's no cop chasing or at least trying to chase the bad guys. After a couple of let downs i shall not watch a movie with 50ct in the cast! Responding to Huump's comment: "Have an open mind when watching movies...enjoy them for what they are and quit looking for what's "wrong" with them " - We cannot enjoy watching what isn't good. The bar has been set so high that it's unbearable watching movies that aren't up to par!

Three stars for the three facial expressions of Fiddy. Bruce Willis loses mad hit points for signing onto this loping mess. If you've never understood the phrase 'he can't act his way out of a paper bag' then it's worth a watch. Fiddy spits wood planks for dialog and Bruce rolls his eyes. Is that a spoiler? The true and fine mark of a Real Crumby Movie is "IT JUST ENDS AND I"M LIKE WHAAA?" I can't fill 10 lines with how bad this 'movie' is. if you like directors who work in two dimensions, this is for you. The Set-Up is the Let-Down and a true example of a film that is 'poser.' with films like THE Italian JOB, SNATCH, TRAINING DAY and the resume of Ray Liotta, who needs this junk? I want my $1.07 and 80 minutes of life back.

****Spoiler Alert****Read This AFTER Watching The Movie****Okay... The movie overall was GOOD. Yes, the acting could have been better, and yes, the script could have been better, but if you stop CRITIQUING everything and just watch the movie, I'm sure you'll be satisfied by the end. A few things didn't make sense (baseball in the winter, the cops not investigating the death of the third friend, the child-hood friends not knowing that their shooter had a sister, etc)I admit, but the sequence of events ARE believable. I can believe a muscle man for the mob would shoot himself while playing with guns THAT AREN'T HIS, thinking he's such an "expert" on weapons. I can believe a hit man found the protagonist in two days...HE'S A FREAKING HIT MAN! THAT'S HIS JOB AND HE'S GOOD AT IT!! I can believe the mob boss found his thief so soon...HE'S A MOB BOSS!! HE KNOWS EVERYTHING (criminal & high-paying) THAT TAKES PLACE IN HIS TOWN OR CUTS INTO HIS MONEY!! As for there being a religious under-tone... I don't think so. It can't be an "undertone" considering that he's robbing people the whole movie, but I believe it has a subliminal message---Pray. Sonny survived situations that most wouldn't have, because he prays. He never kills anyone in the film, because he (although doubtful at times) believes in the word. I think THAT'S what the religious pieces of the film wanted you to see. NO, there wasn't much action in the film, but the movie manages to keep your attention with other things, such as the characters themselves, the mystery of whats next and how everything ties together, and things of that nature. 50 Cent normally plays a tough guy or the boss type, but in this film he's just an average Joe who happens to know how to handle himself. He's not a "bad ass" or a "shooter", but he (having grown up in Detroit and being a thief) knows how to protect himself as well as strike fear in others. He's trying something new, so I don't expect him to be GREAT at it, but he DID make the character believable. Overall, I think the movie is pretty good and a good past-time. Good actors, a decent storyline, nice visuals, and a righteous ending. I'd definitely watch it again. After all, it's definitely not the worst action/crime film I've seen. I mean, hell, THE TOWN was over-rated, dry, and slow as hell!...the robbery scenes were the only good ones, and it aired in theaters! Just because a movie has a lower budget doesn't mean it's worse, and just because a movie has a bunch of hype doesn't mean it's great (look at Green Lantern...horrible). Have an open mind when watching movies...enjoy them for what they are and quit looking for what's "wrong" with them.---------------Huump

I'll start with the music. Every scene begins with a crescendo of dynamic orchestral brilliance, even when the main character is just getting out of a car. There is no need for that. He is just getting out of a car. This continues throughout the film. No matter what happens, there is some brooding, emotional violin accompanying the cast. As for the writing, the dialogue was absolutely atrocious. There was never a moment where you actually felt anything but nothing for the characters in this film. I've seen bad films before, but this million dollar juggernaut of dismal plop has the tax-payers moving along the dole lines, wondering why they can't feed their kids, whilst others can happily spend their money on some tripe. There are starving people in the world that would gladly stay hungry, if you would stop making these rubbish films. Yours sincerely, Some bloke from Ireland

I normally don't write reviews on here but most reviews on here do this movie injustice. It is not nearly ad bad as the score make it out to be.Is this movie predictable? Yes. Does it have clichés and déjà-vu moments? Yes. But what did you expect with a plot that has been done 1 000 000 times before (Heat, The Town, ...). As far as I know most people know about the plot before watching a movie so you know it contains all these flaws before watching it. So don't watch it if you're like: 'this has been done.' If you're a fan of crime/heist movies: watch it!The acting isn't bad at all (but then again I like the acting of Dwayne Johnson). The actors aren't Robert De Niro or Al Pacino but they get the job done.All in all, the movie kept me entertained throughout.
Was watching it on Netflix.... look up for review of it.... after i read a few review... going to quit watching it now... its when u got money to produce a film... but you can't act..... flick

I am absolutely disgusted with this film. It's not even so bad that it's funny, it's just purely horrible. Awful script and even worse acting. Everyone who was in around or near this movie should never go near a movie set again with the exception of Bruce Willis. Bruce secured the bag for 5 minutes if screen time so I can't blame him. This was a literal waste of my life and this movie was so bad that it should be erased from existence.
